SENT.plain: Angelman syndrome is a neurogenetic disorder characterized by developmental delay, absence of speech, motor impairment, exuberant and happy demeanour and epilepsy
It may be caused by various abnormalities of chromosome 15q11-13 affecting the expression ofa gene whose multiple function still need to be clarified
Precise diagnosis carries clinical and genetic counselling implications
However, many clinicians still seem unfamiliar with it, despite the severity and typical aspects of presentation

Beyond individual situations, Angelman syndrome can serve as a paradigm for clinical and basic research into genetic and epigenetic influences in neurology, neurological development, motor control, behavioural phenotypes and epileptic syndromes
Recent advances in molecular biology and animal models of the syndrome provide new data which must be included in our interpretation of Angelman syndrome
